Get England and Wales Census Boundaries

Source: R/get_sf.R
read_census.Rd

read_census downloads Census Boundaries from the ONS Open Geography Portal.

read_census(geog, year = 2011, nations = c("E", "W"), type = "BGC", crs = 4326)

Arguments

geog

Type of census boundaries ("OA", "LSOA", "MSOA")
year

Year (2001 or 2011)
nations

For Which UK nations (c("E","W"))
type

Boundary Clipping

- "BFE": Full Resolution Extent of the Realm (Low Tide)

- "BFC": Full Resolution Clipped (High Tide)

- "BGC": Generalised (20m) Clipped (High Tide)
crs

Coordinate Reference System (ESPG).

It is recommend to use 4326 (World Geodetic System) or potentially 27700 (UK OS British National Grid)

Value

Output is a simple feature object containing the relevant boundaries.

Details

Note: This function is _only_ relevant to England and Wales.

Boundaries included:

- Output Area ("OA")

- Lower Super Output Area ("LSOA")

- Middle Super Output Area ("MSOA")

Examples

read_census("MSOA")

#> Simple feature collection with 7201 features and 7 fields
#> geometry type:  MULTIPOLYGON
#> dimension:      XY
#> bbox:           xmin: -6.418524 ymin: 49.86474 xmax: 1.762942 ymax: 55.81107
#> geographic CRS: WGS 84
#> First 10 features:
#>    objectd        cd                       nm                  ms11nmw st_r_s_
#> 1        1 E02000001       City of London 001       City of London 001 2905399
#> 2        2 E02000002 Barking and Dagenham 001 Barking and Dagenham 001 2165634

#> 4        4 E02000004 Barking and Dagenham 003 Barking and Dagenham 003 2490215

#> 7        7 E02000008 Barking and Dagenham 007 Barking and Dagenham 007 1419309
#> 8        8 E02000009 Barking and Dagenham 008 Barking and Dagenham 008  965622

#>     st_ln__ country                       geometry

if (FALSE) {
read_census("OA", nations = c("E"))
}
